items.sentence: Let\'s solve our own problems first before we try to help Tom.
I wish that I hadn\'t eaten the sandwich that Tom made for me.
I wouldn\'t be able to explain it to you as well as Tom could.
I\'ve already told Tom how much the tickets are going to cost.
As far asÂ I know, it\'s the first time Tom has ever done that.
I didn\'t know whether Tom would be allowed to do that or not.
I didn\'t want any of my friends to know that I was in prison.
Tom later discovered that what Mary had told him wasn\'t true.
Mary pulled an envelope out of her purse and handed it to Tom.
I sometimes just don\'t want to get out of bed in the morning.
If I\'d known Tom was going to be here, I wouldn\'t have come.
If I\'d known Tom was in Boston, I\'d have tried to visit him.
If this plan doesn\'t work, we\'ll have to try something else.
You told Tom that he needed to get more exercise, didn\'t you?
Why in a million years would I want to do something like that?
Would you like a drink while we wait for the others to arrive?
Would you please do me the favor of going to the prom with me?
I wanted to ask Tom to come over to help me paint the ceiling.
Tom wasn\'t able to speak French well enough to be understood.
Tom said there were no decent restaurants in his neighborhood.
